name: Robin Khan
bio: A Chef or Cook is responsible for using their culinary expertise to create appetizing dishes for diners to enjoy. Their duties include overseeing kitchen staff, tasting dishes before going to customers and restocking food produce as needed

recipes.name: Spicy Beef Stir-Fry
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar, red pepper flakes, and water.
2. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. Add the bell peppers, onion, and garlic to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until crisp-tender.
4. Add the beef back to the skillet along with the soy sauce mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
5. Serve hot over rice.

recipes.name: Creamy Tomato Soup
recipes.method:
2. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes, until softened.
2. Add the crushed tomatoes and chicken broth to the pot and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes, until the soup has thickened slightly.
3. Remove the pot from the heat and use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. (Alternatively, let the soup cool slightly and blend in batches in a regular blender.)
4. Stir in the heavy cream and basil
5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Roasted Chicken and Vegetables
recipes.method:
3. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
2. Pat the chicken dry and rub it all over with the olive oil. Sprinkle the salt, pepper, thyme, and garlic powder all over the chicken.
3. Place the chicken in a large roasting pan. Arrange the potatoes, carrots, and onion around the chicken.
4. Roast the chicken for 1-1.5 hours, until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F and the juices run clear.
5. Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving. Serve with the
